snippet: American households saw the largest quarterly increase in debt since before the recession, but whether this signals increased optimism or continued overextension is open to interpretation.
abstract: Federal Reserve Bank of New York releases report showing that American households took on $241 billion in additional debt in fourth quarter of 2013, signaling end of extended period of hunkering down; whether news points to increased optimism or continued overextension is open to interpretation.
lead_paragraph: American households saw the largest quarterly increase in debt since before the recession, but whether this signals increased optimism or continued overextension is open to interpretation.

headline.main: An Ambiguous Omen, U.S. Household Debt Begins to Rise Again
headline.print_headline: An Ambiguous Omen, U.S. Household Debt Begins to Rise Again

keywords.value: Federal Reserve Bank of New York
